title: Lithuania lags far behind EU in recycling plastic waste - LRT
summary: Lithuania recycles three times less plastic than the EU average, and the Economy and Innovation Ministry promises financial incentives to address the problem. title: Cenviro's Contribution To Circular Economy in Advancing Malaysia - The Edge Malaysia
summary: Cenviro, a Malaysian waste management company, is shifting its focus to waste recycling and recovery to become a modern resource company. The company operates a scheduled waste-to-energy (SWtE) plant that transforms scheduled waste into electricity through incineration and a steam turbine. Cenviro is also involved in municipal solid waste management and e-waste recycling.

O2 Recycle for Business has been relaunched to make it easier for businesses to recycle their old devices and get paid for doing so, with businesses receiving cash back, credit towards new devices, or being able to donate funds to charity. title: TSA, Clark Rubber partnership to revolutionise tyre waste problem - Waste Management Review
summary: The Tyre Stewardship Australia Market Development Fund and Clark Rubber have partnered to increase the use of recycled tyre-derived material in new products in Australia. The fund provides grants of up to $250,000 to organizations that can demonstrate how rubber from used tires can be used as an ingredient in new products. This collaboration aims to create innovative, sustainable solutions and support the development of a circular economy for used tires in Australia.

summary: Mobile network operator O2 has relaunched their ‘O2 Recycle for Business’ to help businesses of all sizes trade in their old technology, and more than 3.8 million devices have been processed since 2009.
